intro: Vernonia longifolia var. vahliana, commonly known as the longleaf vernonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow to orange composite flower heads. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features include fibrous roots, opposite leaf arrangement, and capitulum inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
